channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: No reinstatement, 13th August
item.description:
It's almost 6 months since this "temporary" repair was carried out. It is a total disgrace - nobody seems to care, nobody checks, nobody responds to my previous request for action. This is hideous and the contractors should be forced - as is GCC's obligation under I believe Section 106 - to ensure that this is made good ASAP or in any event within 6 months. Please do not simply send me another standard response and ignore the problem as you did last time. By the way, I think this fixmystreet is a very poor app.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Ashford Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Temp lights with huge traffic jams, 13th August
item.description:
The lights are set to 4 way according to the sign. The main shurdington road to and from Cheltenham is queuing to the dual carriageway one direction and past the roundabout at the other. The signals priority need amending. Gigaclear main head office number does not work.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shurdington Road, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light head is facing wrong direction

item.title: Multiple banners fallen down, 13th August
item.description:
All along the A435 Evesham Rd GCC all the banners promoting the development of a cycle track have all worked loose from cable ties and fallen down
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Evesham Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous horses, 13th August
item.description:
I was kicked by a horse on the public footpath near this farm today. The map shows where we escaped to avoid the horses after the incident. It was an entirely unprovoked attack. We were walking through the field on a pu lic footpath when the horses came at us at some speed. They were not deterred by stamping feet at them, waving arms and in the end by people waving sticks at them. I was.kicked on the left buttock as I bent down to let my dog off the lead as is the advice when confronted by dangerous animals. I am lucky it wasn't my head or knees. They continued to chase us even after the dog had got out of the field along with three of our group. The other photos show where the horse kicked me, and the farm signage when we reached the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brockworth Road, Brockworth, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grass uncut for over a year, 13th August
item.description:
The verges and grass patch have not been cut for over a year! Chelt/tewks council say not their responsibility. Housing association say not their responsibility!! Been told itâ€™s down to Gloucestershire Council??? Reported three times!!!! Have had to cut myself and have ended up with 5 bags of growth!!!!!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Symphony Road, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury

item.title: Abandoned temporary traffic signs Marle Hill Road, 13th August
item.description:
Various temporary traffic signs and a cone just inside the entrance to Pittville Park between 15 & 17 Marle Hill Road. Some of these are left by the cycle path contractors. Others may be from student house clear outs.
